stories.title: Hedge Funds Walk Away from LME After $3.9B Trades Torn Up

stories.text:
I recently started working as a data engineer in a consulting & service provider company (after working in academia for about 1 year) and have some time, a few working weeks, to refresh some DE basic knowledge and maybe learn some relevant tools. I have a background in CS did some student jobs working on dev & data science tasks.

I started learning Apache Spark & get familiar with the Databricks tools, after talking to some more experienced colleagues, and I am currently learning via the "Data Engineer learning path" courses at the "Databricks Academy". It is a mix of lectures and smaller hands-on tasks using notebooks. A good chunk of the 30hrs+ learning material is related to Apache Spark (12hrs+), but also some modules related to Databricks-specific tools. Some things are familiar for me due to my background (python/scala, dataframes, queries, basic sql-like transformations, ...) while some stuff is new and/or different.

I usually pick up (tech) skills by working on real projects and tasks. Therefore I do not know where to continue after finishing my courses. I'm very bad at coming up with my own project ideas, mainly because I can't estimate the scope of the project and what I would learn from it.

Do you have any recommendations on what to do after finishing the course? Maybe some useful links for project ideas, ideally with usable data or solutions to evaluate / compare ? I stumbled upon some github repos for data (science) projects, but nothing related to Spark which I could use to strengthen my skills.
stories.title: Ask HN: Continue learning Apache Spark after online course
